Text: So...where do we start?

Hmm, let's see... I'll let you two decide. Is there
anything in particular you'd like to see?

It's all so new to me that I can't choose. All of the
stands look so delightful and charming.

Yes, it's true. If time allows, I'd love to see
everything...

In that case, what say we split up and you each go
check out whatever interests you? Then you can swap
info later. How about that?

What a great idea! We should be able to cover much
more ground in groups of two.

Yes, I agree. It's the best, most efficient option.
Now, why don't you start by accompanying her first?

Dear me, are you certain? Wouldn't you prefer to have
a gentlemanly escort as you take in the sights?

Of course I would. But all things require a guiding
hand in the beginning, and I don't like the idea of
leaving you on your own.

True. Elisabeth here is kind of a lost lamb when it
comes to the modern world.
Thank you both for your concern.
Hehe, you're welcome. Well, catch you later.
How about we get moving, too?
Yes, let's. Might I ask for your company, good sir?
Sure, that's why I'm here. So where to first?

I'm curious about the foods being sold in the night
market. I confess that I'm a light eater, but I was
hoping to sample as many things as possible...

Alright, then we'll start with something that isn't
too heavy.
What is this...?

A shaved ice stand. I thought it'd be good since it
won't fill you up much and is also a summer festival
standby.

Is this...nothing more that sweet syrup poured over
ice? I fail to see what could be so remarkable about
that...

Don't overthink it. You'll understand once you have
a bite.
Well, if you insist... I shall give it a try.
Oh my goodness...!
This...this is a delicacy!
See?

The texture of the shaved ice is like fluffy powdered
snow... And this strawberry syrupâ€”a tart tincture
that melts in the mouth alongside the ice... 
Absolutely wonderful.

I'm sorry that I ever looked down on it as mere ice
shavings doused in syrup.

I love how soft and easy it is to eat, with the
pleasant surprise that it is not overly filling at
all. The people of this era have created a true
frozen marvel.

Heheheh, don't get too surprised just yet. Wait until
you try cotton candy.

Cotton...candy? Given the name, I'm guessing it must
be sweet?
Here, try some.

My, it's as fluffy as a cloud! I wonder what it will
taste like...

...Oh, it melts inside the mouth right away! It's
like trying to bite into mist, and yet so sweet it
makes my tongue tingle... Heehee, splendid, like
something out of a dream.
Sounds like you're a fan.

Yes, to say the least. Unlike ice, this cotton candy
will not melt with time, so I can likely even take
some back as a souvenir for Mary.

(A souvenir, huh... The thing is, cotton candy sucks
in warm air and hardens really fast...)

(Nah, I'll spare her the cruel truth. Those little
next-day letdowns are part of the summer festival
experience, too.)

Say, my good sir. That stall over there says
"sculpted candy." Do you mind if we have a look?
Not at all.
Hm...? That man standing over there...
Excuse me.
What is it?

It's not a good idea for you to stay here. Don't you
think you should head home?

...Oh, so you mean that little feeling I had was
right? I thought that might be the case. Well, I've
had my fun, so guess I'll be heading back.

(He left way easier than I expected... Kinda feel bad
about interrupting his fun, but it is what it is.)
(Now where's Elisabeth...)

Wow, so you make it to order on the spot? In that
case...can you make me a bat?

(She's totally engrossed in the candy-making... Which
means maybe I can go check up on Violet.)

Oh, drat, I missed again... But even when I hit, the
targets never fall! This is so difficult...
Do I have to use a gun to play this game?

That's what we call doing whatever it takes to win
and then getting so caught up in the doing that you
forget about the winning... But yeah, this is a target
range, so you have to use a gun.

Oh...how long have you been watching? You mean imp.
You could've said something earlier.

Well, I didn't want to break your concentration.
But, hey, can I give you little advice?
Yes, please do.

It's easier to keep your aim steady if you hold the
gun with both hands. Use just one and it tends to
drift.

Also, the big prizes don't tip over easy. So instead
of just trying to shoot it and knock it down, you
want to aim where you think will throw of its center
of gravity.

Trust the modern boy to even be an expert on target
shooting.

I wouldn't call myself an expert, it's just that I've
done this before.

Okay, then I'll take your advice...and aim with both
hands...

Wow, not bad. All three shots hit. Congrats on
nabbing the prize.
Hehe, oh, I'm not through yet.

Now you hit will all five shots. Somebody sure is a
quick learner. I'm impressed.
Maybe it's because I had a good teacher.
So much flattery. What're you scheming?

The truth is, I've become aware of something very
distressing. I was hoping we might discuss it.
Something very distressing?

Well, you're aware of my current situation, yes?
It's not like I was able to bring anything with me.
O-Okay, and...?
So can I borrow the money for the target game?

(Wait, so without a single zeni on her, she was able
to play with just a promise to pay later? Violet
sure knows how to get her way...)

...Sure, I can loan you a little. But I do mean just
a little. And make sure to pay me back. I barely
squeak by on my allowance as it is.

Hehe, of course. And thank you. I know I can always
count on you.
